title: Question for the reds
body:
I post fairly often, this one marks my 200th post and I have noticed that every now and again you guys like to remove my content.

Now, i get there are rules in place and i do my best to follow guidelines and not be a troll however I never get to see the posts you remove so I can know why I was considered stepping over the line with some of the stuff I have said.

I am not bashing on your decision to remove them as i'm sure they are perfectly fair (your reasons), but citing "quoted infraction" does not tell me much as to why I broke the rules. If there can be a feature for clarification (aka a copy of the post removed) I would be very grateful as I feel it is a waste of everyone's time following it up in support which process a lot of requests already...

Thank you for your consideration ;)

replies.body:
Why were you counting your posts. that's weird.
also are you saying you send a support ticket every time one of your posts gets removed? jesus, if I did that they'd have their hands full answering my tickets alone.
